Art. 4.60. 
Amicable conversion 
Where all the bare owners and the surviving spouse are of full age and capable, they may in any event proceed by mutual agreement and as they have agreed, to the conversion of the surviving spouse's usufruct or to the transfer of the bare ownership of the property referred to in Article 4.61, ¤ 7. 
If there is a minor or other incapable person among them, the conversion is carried out in accordance with the provisions of Article 1206 of the Judicial Code.
In the absence of agreement, the conversion takes place judicially in accordance with article 4.63.
